text: And for me, the real world involves everything: risk, danger, beauty, energy, all we meet with in the real world.
author: Christo

text: Throughout the centuries, man has considered himself beautiful. I rather suppose that man only believes in his own beauty out of pride that he is not really beautiful and he suspects this himself for why does he look on the face of his fellow-man with such scorn?
author: Isidore Ducasse Lautreamont

text: Poetry a criticism of life under the conditions fixed for such a criticism by the laws of poetic truth and poetic beauty.
author: Matthew Arnold

text: The concept of active cooperation has taken the place of opposition to the new form of government and of dreamy resignation entranced with the beauty of times past.
author: Gustav Stresemann

text: We say we want to create beauty, identity, quality, singularity. And yet, maybe in truth these cities that we have are desired. Maybe their very characterlessness provides the best context for living.
author: Rem Koolhaas
